_prev_prog_3.EquipmentTested: Compressors, vessels, condensers, evaporators, and piping.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
EXECUTIVE SUMMARY



Sysco Food Services of West Coast Florida, Inc. in Palmetto has developed a Risk Management Program in compliance with the Environmental Protection Agencies final Rule 40 CFR Part 68.  The regulated substance is anhydrous ammonia with a total inventory charge of 2,000 lbs. which is over the threshold quantity of 10,000 lbs.  Since the facility is also subject to the Occupational Safety and Health Administration's PSM Standard 29 CFR 1910.119, Program 3 is required.



ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION POLICY



The top priority of Sysco Food Services of West Coast Florida, Inc. is to provide a healthy and safe work environment for its employees and the surrounding community.  In this effort Sysco Food Services of West Coast Florida, Inc. has developed strict policies and procedures to reduce the risk of an accidental hazardous chemical release.  The Process Safety Management (PSM) program acts as a gatekeeper of these policies and procedures.



The requirements of the Occupational Safety and Health Administration's (OSHA) PSM Standard 29 CFR 1910.119 mirrors that of Risk Management's Prevention Program 3 and therefore been integrated.  Of the 14 PSM elements 13 focus on accidental release prevention and one on emergency planning and response.  It is the commitment of management and employees to follow the established procedures and seek new ways for improvement. 



EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICY



The facility has developed an Emergency Response Plan with specific actions to be taken in response to accidental releases.  Sysco Food Services of West Coast Florida has designated and trained employees that will respond in emergency situations.  Sysco Food Services of West Coast Florida provides annual refresher training and schedules periodic meetings and drills.



Copies of the Sysco Food Services of West Coast Florida, Inc. Emergency Response Plan has been submitted to the Tampa Bay Regional Local Emergency Planning Committee.



STATIONARY SOURCE AND

REGULATED SUBSTANCES

Sysco Food Services of West Coast Florida is a food service distributor located in Palmetto, Florida.  The process includes refrigerated spaces that utilize anhydrous ammonia as the refrigerant.  Anhydrous ammonia is a regulated substance under the Chemical Accidental Prevention Provisions, 40 CFR 68.





WORST CASE RELEASE SCENARIO AND ALTERNATE RELEASE SCENARIO

The Worst Case Release Scenario and Alternate Release Scenario, including administrative controls and mitigation measures to limit the distance for the reported scenario have been completed and are included in the enclosed RMP Submittal text file.



To evaluate both the worst case and alternate release scenarios, EPA's RMP Comp was utilized.  RMP Comp is an acceptable model for the mathematical approximation process.  Public and environmental receptors that could possibly be affected by the scenarios were determined through the use of LANDVIEW 6 mapping system software and US Census Bureau 2010 data.



GENERAL ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM

CHEMICAL-SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS



EPA's Risk Management Prevention Program 3, 40 CFR Part 68(D) and OSHA's Process Safety Management Standard 29 CFR 1910.119 outline the facilities accidental release prevention program.  Included are 13 Chemical Specific Prevention steps implemented by Sysco Food Services of West Coast Florida, Inc. and are summarized below.



Employee Participation - Employees are given shared responsibility with management in the continued evolution of the program.

Process Safety Information -Chemical, equipment, and system information has been compiled to ensure the safe design and operation.

Process Hazard Analysis - Hazardous Operability Study (HAZOP) completed to identify potential hazards and minimize their impact.

Operating Procedures - Standard Operating Procedures developed to ensure the safe operation of the process.

Training - Training program established and operators trained to ensure the safe oper

ation of the process.

Contractors - Contractor program established to ensure only qualified and trained contractor work on or near the process.

Pre-Startup Safety Review - Procedures and checklist developed to ensure all safety requirements completed before startup of new or modified process.

Mechanical Integrity -Program developed to ensure equipment and systems installed per design specifications and maintained per manufacturer recommendations and good engineering practices.

Hot Work Permit - Permit program established to prevent the potential of fire/explosion resulting from hot work near hazardous chemicals.

Management of Change - Procedures established to manage process changes to ensure the integrity of the PSM program is maintained.

Incident Investigations - Procedures established to investigate releases that resulted in or could have resulted in a catastrophic release of a hazardous chemical to prevent reoccurrence.

Compliance Audits - Procedures established to periodically review program implementation and to correct as necessary.

Trade Secrets - Policy implemented to provide all necessary information regardless of trade secrets to ensure the employee safety.



ACCIDENT HISTORY - LAST FIVE YEARS

There have been no RMP reportable accidents within the past five years.







EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM



Sysco Food Services of West Coast Florida, Inc. Emergency Response Program calls for evacuation of the facility in the event of a hazardous chemical emergency. The facility will respond in performing rescue, control and containment, and clean-up operations. The facility maintains a written Emergency Response Plan to document specific procedures to be implemented in the event of various emergencies, including hazardous chemical releases. The Emergency Release Plan includes procedures for facility evacuation, as well as for notification to the local emergency response agencies. The plan is promptly updated to reflect any pertinent changes taking place

within the facility that would require modified procedures.



Sysco Food Services of West Coast Florida, Inc. has devised a comprehensive emergency response program, designed to protect both employees and the community in the event of a release. This program is fully described in a document entitled Emergency Response Plan (ERP) in order to facilitate response efforts in the event of a hazardous chemical release. Included in the plan are measures to be taken internally by Sysco Food Services of West Coast Florida, Inc. as well as measures to be taken by off-site response agencies. 



Sysco Food Services of West Coast Florida, Inc. has trained on-site personnel to respond to accidental hazardous chemical releases. These personnel are trained in accordance with 29 CFR 1910.120, Hazardous Operations and Emergency Response regulations according to their duties and function. These personnel also receive initial training and annual update training thereafter. 



To assure that the local governmental response agencies are familiar with Sysco Food Services of West Coast Florida, Inc. emergency response procedures, Sysco Food Services of West Coast Florida, Inc. has provided copies of the ERP for review and approval by the local agencies. 



To plan for an ammonia release with off-site impact, Sysco Food Services of West Coast Florida, Inc. includes procedures/equipment to mitigate the release, procedures to inform local response agencies, evacuation route maps, and procedures for public communication.



PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY

Sysco Food Services of West Coast Florida, Inc. will incorporate or address any recommendations resulting from the Process Hazard Analysis, Incident Investigations and Compliance Audits.  The flexibility of the program allows Sysco Food Services of West Coast Florida, Inc. to respond effectively to prevent or minimize any potential of exposing Sysco Food Services of West Coast Florida, Inc. employees, the surrounding public, and/or th
e environment to a release of anhydrous ammonia.
